attributes.action: Increase support for the nightlife economy sector during the pandemic.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK's nightlife sector is worth £66 billion. It is the 5th biggest industry in the UK making 8% of all employment opportunities. 
Since we went into Lockdown, nightclubs and events have been unable to reopen in any form of capacity.  Whilst pubs and bars have been limited due to restrictions making it harder for them to compete with supermarkets. The 10pm curfew has now shackled the industry further and without appropriate support now, there will be no more industry post pandemic.
attributes.background: Provide a robust support package for buisnesses that fall within the late-night sector and therefore are most affected by current restrictions.  In addition, ensure that any further restrictions have sufficient scientific backing prior to public announcement.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332789
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320711
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331625

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
